CatDescriptText: Mrs. Virginia Johnson, 1500 Brighton Place, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 26, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "In your opinion, what constitutes the 'Leadership' in Negro community in Pittsburgh? What do you think of that which exists?" answer reads: "Negro leadership is fair.  I say fair because there are a lot of places where we still can't be served and there are other instances like pushing and shoving Negroes on the street car.  If Negro leadership was really good, we would not have to face these things."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Virginia Johnson wearing earrings, two strand necklace, and light colored trench coat, holding dark handbag under left arm, standing in front of Rosenbaum Company, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
